Customer due diligence measures

28.—(1) The customer due diligence measures which a relevant person must apply under regulation 27 are—

(a) identifying the customer unless the identity of that customer is known to, and has been verified by, the relevant person;

(b) verifying the customer's identity unless the customer's identity has already been verified by the relevant person;

(c) assessing, and where appropriate obtaining information on, the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship or occasional transaction.

(2) A relevant person must identify the customer by requiring the customer to provide—
(a) the customer's full name; and
(b) at least one of the following—
(i) the customer's date of birth;
(ii) the customer's place of birth;
(iii) the customer's nationality.

(3) Where the customer is an individual, the relevant person must also, in the course of identifying the customer, require the customer to provide the customer's residential address.
